      • copyPartialMatches

        public static <T extends java.util.Collection<java.lang.String>> T copyPartialMatches(java.lang.String token,
                                                                                      java.lang.Iterable<java.lang.String> originals,
                                                                                      T collection)
                                                                               throws java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException,
                                                                                      java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Copies all elements from the iterable collection of originals to the collection provided.
        Parameters:
        token - String to search for
        originals - An iterable collection of strings to filter.
        collection - The collection to add matches to
        Returns:
        the collection provided that would have the elements copied into
        Throws:
        java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException - if the collection is immutable and originals contains a string which starts with the specified search string.
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if any parameter is is null
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if originals contains a null element. Note: the collection may be modified before this is thrown

      • equals

        public static boolean equals(@Nullable
                             java.lang.String left,
                             @Nullable
                             java.lang.String right,
                             boolean caseSensitive)
        Provides a shorthand for changing if strings match while allowing for a case sensitive check.
        Parameters:
        left - The first string
        right - The second string
        caseSensitive - Is case sensitive
        Returns:
        Returns true if they match. If either string is null, we return false.

      • startsWithIgnoreCase

        public static boolean startsWithIgnoreCase(@Nonnull
                                           java.lang.String str,
                                           @Nonnull
                                           java.lang.String... prefixes)
                                    throws java.lang.NullPointerException
        This method uses a substring to check case-insensitive equality. This means the internal array does not need to be copied like a toLowerCase() call would.
        Parameters:
        str - String to check
        prefixes - Prefix of string to compare
        Returns:
        true if provided string starts with, ignoring case, the prefix provided
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if prefix is null
